benchmark_details.name: PennyLang
benchmark_details.overview: PennyLang is a high-quality dataset of 3,347 PennyLane-specific quantum code samples with contextual descriptions, curated from textbooks, official documentation, and open-source repositories, designed for quantum programming using PennyLane.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a structured dataset specifically for LLM-based quantum code generation and assist developers in writing optimized quantum code using PennyLane.

data.source: Curated from GitHub repositories, quantum computing textbooks, and official PennyLane documentation.
data.annotation: Manual verification and contextual descriptions added to each code sample.

methodology.calculation: Success Rate is calculated as pass@5 / 264 x 100, where pass@5 indicates the number of test cases for which at least one correct solution was generated among the five attempts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate better model performance in generating correct quantum code.
methodology.baseline_results: Open-source models like Qwen 7B and LLaMa 4 showed significant improvements when evaluated with the PennyLang dataset.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through a benchmark suite comprising 264 test cases assessed across multiple LLMs.
